body.p: The Basic Contractor Board has these connections ():

Inputs:
Remote EPO: Dry contact connection point for input of an REPO signal. Connect external dry contacts to terminals marked +24V EPO RET (). The REPO signal is sent to the PDU Board via the REMOTE EPO connection, which is not a customer connection point. Connection of voltage to this point can cause damage to the unit/
Four (4) Building Alarms (). Alarm names can be specified by Eaton PDI in PDU Board setup. Outputs:

li.p:
Four (4) remote relays that output dry contact (NO) signals (). (Note: Remote relay scan accept dry contacts rated up to 2A/250V.)
Relays are programmable using the USB setup connection on the PDU M4G Board. Eaton PDI programs the relay inputs, usually in manufacturing. So for example, a relay can be programmed to turn on when a specific Building Alarm, such as a fire alarm, is received. The building management system or other control system receives the relay input and can cause PDU shutdown with an REPO signal.
By default, the first, left-most relay is programmed to close when the PDU Summary Alarm, PDU Board points list, Modbus Register 70, is in alarm ().

ul.li: Modbus Connection: 4-wire configuration connection is located on the customer connection terminal block.

li.p: Modbus Connections: The board has customer connections for upstream and downstream 4-wire Modbus ().
